ManiaC87,
Although that may be true, I think everyone deserves a chance to try it out first. Sure there are demos, but they are often way too limited and doesn't give you a chance to see all the features you will be buying. Maybe a demo looks cool, but then the full game is short, lacks features, etc. and wasn't really worth buying.

Anyways, I'll probably wait for the XBox360 version. I prefer playing racing games with a controller, and most PC games doesn't feature analog thumbsticks. :(
If no crack becomes available before then, I might have to satisfy myself with the 360-demo of the game.

SoundWall: Flatout 2 doesn't support wheels officially (but my Logitech wheel works) and they want you to use pads like the rumble pad (the analogue steering works). I bought the game the same day it was released. I have been looking for a no-dvd crack just to save the DVD from being destroyed by the two-year-old. The original Flatout was cracked, so how come they managed to crack it? Not Starforce protection on that one?
